intro: Viguiera hidalgoana, commonly known as Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and chrysanthemums, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its vibrant orange to red flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viguiera hidalgoana is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
